meanings.definition: The act of adding darkness or color to a drawing or painting to create depth and dimension.
meanings.sent1: The artist used shading to make the tree look more realistic.
meanings.sent2: She practiced shading to improve her art skills.
meanings.sent3: The shading on the portrait made the subject appear mysterious.
meanings.sent4: The shading in the landscape painting brought the mountains to life.
meanings.sent5: Her shading technique made the still life painting pop off the canvas.

meanings.definition: A slight variation or difference in degree or quality.
meanings.sent1: There was a subtle shading in the color of the sky at sunset.
meanings.sent2: The shading of the fabric gave it a textured appearance.
meanings.sent3: The shading of flavors in the dish created a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: The shading of emotions on her face hinted at hidden feelings.
meanings.sent5: The shading of the music added depth to the performance.

meanings.definition: The gradual transition from light to dark in a drawing or painting.
meanings.sent1: The artist focused on perfecting the shading in the portrait.
meanings.sent2: The shading on the horizon captured the essence of dusk.
meanings.sent3: The shading on the flower petals made them look like they were glowing.
meanings.sent4: The shading in the background created a sense of depth in the artwork.
meanings.sent5: Her careful shading technique made the portrait come alive.
